intro: Manettia hassleriana, commonly known as the white-flowered manettia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial plant in humid, shaded environments. The flowers are often visited by small insects and birds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
